Description: Torn rectangle of a linen tunic; in the panel is a horseman, between the legs of the horse is an animal (rabbit?), this is framed by a similar frieze to the band ie: floral and vegetal tracery, this is also framed with pyramidal motifs; plain weave: warp-undyed linen (S/24), weft-undyed linen (S/18); part of the neck opening remains and is reinforced with sewing in undyed linen, at the end of the opening are two picks of c.6-7 bundled threads, a line of chain stitching? and several picks of grouped threads; one simple selvedge; other edges are cut; tapestry: includes one clavus (56x3cm) in undyed linen and purple/blue wool, warp-undyed linen (doubled/9 ribs per cm), weft- undyed linen (S/68) and purple wool (Z/80), freize with floral and vegetal outlines (tracery) and two felines oriented towards the neck opening, at the end of the clavus a small medallion with a floral and vegetal motif; 1.5cm under the claus is a square (tabula, 15.7x14.7cm) tapestry applied, undyed linen and purple wool, warp-undyed linen (doubled/9 ribs per cm) weft-undyed linen (S/60), purple wool (Z/56); flying thread in undyed linen
Acquisition name: Purchased through: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
